clusters.title: Police swarm WA school after social media shooting threat
clusters.neutral_headline: Police swarm WA school after social media shooting threat

items.title: Police swarm WA school after social media shooting threat
items.standfirst: Mount Lawley Senior High School students claimed they were told to hide under desks after a video, allegedly made by a teenager, surfaced on TikTok.
items.content: Policeswarmed one of Perth's biggest high schools today over a social media shooting threat.Mount Lawley Senior High School students claimed they were told to hide under desks after a video, allegedly made by a teenager, surfaced on TikTok.Students told 9News they were warned by friends about going to school after the video, which was shared on Thursday, allegedly identified specific targets. READ MORE: Accused cold case killer bailed but case against him 'not weak'READ MORE: Proud Digger reflects 80 years after end of World War IIPolice today circled the campus but their official line was "there are no safety concerns or imminent risks".Despite that, students say their teachers told them to be prepared."They were like stay under your desks, we'll turn the lights off and we gotta keep quiet until we get the all clear," one student said.In a letter, Mount Lawley Senior High School told parents of "online content" about the school but made no mention of a threat of shooting.Police continue to investigate.Anyone with information can contacted Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000. DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

items.title: Police investigating TikTok shooting threats at Perth high school
items.standfirst: Online threats posted on social media referencing school shootings and apparently directed at students at Mt Lawley Senior High School are being investigated by police.
items.content: Online threats posted on social media referencing school shootings and apparently directed at students at Mt Lawley Senior High School are being investigated by police.

items.title: 'Imputed rent' and what it could mean for a fairer Australia
items.standfirst: As industry leaders and the federal government prepare for next week's economic summit, two economists have started a national conversation by arguing that, to make Australia's tax system fairer, we should consider taxing home owner-occupancy. Here's what that means.
